com.innowhere.jnieasy.core.mem
Interface NativeStateManager

public interface NativeStateManager

Every native object instance has an internal object implementing NativeStateManager interface.

This NativeStateManager object controls all native operations, that is, any operation with the native instance that modifies or gets data from native memory.

The native state manager object of a native instance can be got with the method NativeCapable.jnieasyGetNativeStateManager(), but is recommended use NativeCapableUtil.getNativeStateManager(Object).

Author:
Jose M. Arranz Santamaria

Method Summary
 NativeBuffer getBuffer()
          Returns the NativeBuffer object representing the native memory of the native object from which this NativeStateManager comes from.
 NativeCapable getNativeCapable()
          Returns the native object instance from which this NativeStateManager comes from.
 NativeManager getNativeManager()
          Returns the NativeManager object.
 boolean isInsideTxn()
          Returns true is the native object is enrolled in a native transaction.
 

Method Detail

getBuffer

NativeBuffer getBuffer()
Returns the NativeBuffer object representing the native memory of the native object from which this NativeStateManager comes from.

Returns:
the NativeBuffer of the native object, never is null.
See Also:
NativeCapableUtil.getBuffer(Object)

getNativeCapable

NativeCapable getNativeCapable()
Returns the native object instance from which this NativeStateManager comes from.

The returned object is never null although the object may be non-native. Be care holding NativeStateManager objects because this prevents the related object be garbage collected. The framework never holds NativeStateManager objects with strong references.

Returns:
the managed native object instance.
See Also:
NativeCapable.jnieasyGetNativeStateManager()

getNativeManager

NativeManager getNativeManager()
Returns the NativeManager object.

Returns:
the native manager object.
See Also:
NativeCapableUtil.getNativeManager(Object)

isInsideTxn

boolean isInsideTxn()
Returns true is the native object is enrolled in a native transaction.

Returns:
true is the native object is inside a native transaction.
See Also:
NativeTransaction, NativeCapableUtil.isInsideTxn(Object)
